 You are here Home  /  Research Services  /  Getting Started  /  Learn About Research Fundamentals 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Learn About Research Fundamentals 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Your introduction to research at the UCR Library. 
 Build Your Toolkit: 
 
 Library Overview  (video): A 13-minute video that shares the basics of UCR Library services and collections 
 VPN Access : Learn about how to get access to library resources from off-campus (includes videos) 
 UCR Catalog  (video): How to find and access books, articles, and more through the UCR Catalog
	 
 Access to books and other resources during the COVID-19 closure 
 Reserves  (video): Borrow your course textbooks for short periods of time 
 Call Numbers  (video): How to find a physical book in the Library 
 Additional help with the Catalog 
 
 
 Search Strategy  (video): How to create successful searches in Library databases 
 Database Searching  (video): Discover time-saving tools for conducting research 
 Using the Opposing Viewpoints in Context Database  (video): Especially helpful for students in the ENGL 001A-B-C series 
 
 Plagiarism and Citation: 
 
 Avoiding Plagiarism  - It's easy to do if you're informed 
 Citing Your Sources  - Resources to help put the finishing touch on your bibliography and citations 
 Managing Your Sources  - Tools to help you keep track of all your research and format your citations at the end 
 
 More for Your Toolkit: 
 
 Conducting a Literature Review  - Explains how to analyze sources and write a literature review 
 Writing an Annotated Bibliography  - Reviews sources, guidelines, and tools to help you write an annotated bibliography 
 Primary Sources  -  What are they and how do you find them 
 Ebook Readers  - How to access ebooks on a variety of platforms
